_prev_prog_3.Description: South Hampton Resources Inc. is subject to OSHA 's Process Safety Management program. SHRI has a PSM program in process to cover  the regulatory requirements. All the regulated processes fall under PSM and therefore Prevention Program 3 under the Risk Management Program. The facility has eight covered processes. They are Penhex, Reformer, Aromax, Penreco, Cyclo, Tank Farm, Advanced Aromatics, and Isomerization.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
South Hampton Resources Inc. employs approximately 150 people who live and work in the Silsbee, Texas area. In business at the same location since 1955, the company is the producer of high purity solvents which are used by its customers to manufacture such things as expandable polystyrene and polyethylene. These products are then used to manufacture such consumer staples as styrofoam cups and plastics. South Hampton is also active in performing tolling work for various companies.



The Risk Management Program requires the development of scenarios for the accidental release of a toxic or flammable chemical. None of the toxic chemicals listed in the regulation is present at South Hampton above the threshold quantity so no scenarios have been developed. The worst case scenario for a flammable chemical involved the instantaneous release of approximately 1.8 MM pounds of pentane . The resultant vapor cloud explosion would affect an estimated radius of 1 mile. The alternative case scenario for a flammable chemical involved the release of 2800 pounds per minute of isopentane in a 10 minute time period. The release distance for this scenario is less than 0.1 miles.



The accident prevention measures in place at South Hampton include pressure relief to the flare, secondary pressure relief to the atmosphere for storage tanks, dike walls to control spills, remote valves to isolate tanks, a mechanical integrity inspection program, a leak detection and repair program, and 24 hour on-site surveillance.



The flammable regulated substances that are present at South Hampton above the threshold quantity are hydrogen, methane, ethane, ethylene, propane, isobutane, butane, isopentane, and pentane.



South Hampton has had no reportable quantities released in the past five years. 



South Hampton has an integrated contingency plan. In the event of emergency, Garner Environmental will be the response contractor that will be used by South Hampton. The Silsbee Fire Department and the

Hardin County Local Emergency Planning Commission are also resources which are available.



South Hampton understands that no operation can be completely safe. South Hampton recognizes that safety is an onging endeavor. Continual improvement is essential. Input from employees and from the community are key elements in ensuring that the improvements in safety continue.
